description: Least positive integer k for which the Jacobi symbol (k|2*n-1) is less than 1, where 2*n-1 is a nonsquare; a(n)=0 if 2*n-1 is a square.
references: S. R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge, 2003, pp. 443-448.
P. Ribenboim, The New Book of Prime Number Records, 3rd ed., Springer-Verlag 1996; Math. Rev. 96k:11112.
links: R. Baillie and S. S. Wagstaff, Lucas pseudoprimes, Math. Comp. 35 (1980) 1391-1417; Math. Rev. 81j:10005
maple: A053761 := proc(n) if issqr(2*n-1) then return 0 ; else for k from 1 do if numtheory[jacobi](k,2*n-1) < 1 then return k; end if; end do: end if; end proc: seq(A053761(n),n=1..100) ; # _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 08 2010
mathematica: a[n_] := If[IntegerQ[Sqrt[2*n - 1]], Return[0], For[ k = 1, True, k++, If[ JacobiSymbol[k, 2*n - 1] < 1 , Return[k]]]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 100}] (* _Jean-FranÃ§ois Alcover_, Jun 20 2013, after R. J. Mathar *)
author: _Steven Finch_, Apr 05 2000
extensions: More terms from _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 08 2010
